about.name: Our Story
about.story: The next-generation sequencing revolution has led to a significant understanding of biology, disease processes, and fundamental biochemistry. Unprecedented insight into the diversity of individuals and their biochemical makeup has occurred over the past few years. The availability of this information allows for a broader selection of targets and a significant opportunity for furthering the discovery of novel therapeutics. The next juncture in this industry is having the right size and scale of biochemical tools to capture the enormous opportunity created by this trend. Abpro was formed with this in mind and is in a unique position in this dynamic industry, leveraging an industrial approach to create tools and high affinity antibodies to diverse targets that may differ by as little as a single DNA base pair. Our antibodies are used in key markets such as for research, diagnostics and as therapeutics.

-KKFi5LHkpU696HTyS4w.description:
Job description

We have an opening for an energetic scientist who will lead the development of monoclonal antibodies for customers that include top pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies.

Responsibilities

  • Generate monoclonal antibodies for applications in basic research, diagnostics and therapeutics.
  • Perform lymph node and spleen dissections to harvest lymphocytes for fusion with myeloma cells to produce hybridomas.
  • Maintain hybridoma cell cultures, and direct the selection of hybridomas expressing antibodies with desired properties in immunoassay procedures including ELISA, western blot, IHC, and flow cytometry.
  • Design, optimize and execute extensive assay development activities, which must include optimizing sandwich, neutralizing, and blocking ELISAs.
  • Antibody characterization including by HPLC, SDS PAGE and affinity measurements using ForteBio or Biacore SPR methods.
  • Produce and purify antibodies from hybridoma supernatants.
  • Organize all aspects of multiple concurrent antibody generation projects and effectively communicate the status and progress to customers.

Key Skills and Competencies

  • Requires: PhD in Immunology, Molecular Biology, or related field, or MS/BS with at least 3-5 years of related experience
  • Strong communication skills, high initiative/energy, and must be a team player.
-KKFi5LHkpU696HTyS4w.name: Research Scientist

-KKFiNckpfjZlmnOCgKW.description:
Job Description

We are seeking a highly motivated individual to join us as a Research Associate in our Therapeutic research team. You will work with the research team in supporting our efforts in this exciting new area of cancer immunotherapy. Under minimal supervision, the successful candidate will be expected to perform experiments, organize and analyze results, and communicate and present findings in team meetings. You will also be asked to perform other duties as required. This role will be a hands-on resource reporting to a Scientist.

Requirements

  • Two years of related experience in a lab environment with a Master’s Degree or at least 4 years of related experience in a lab environment with a Bachelor’s Degree
  • Antibody and protein optimization laboratory research experience is required, particularly in molecular biology and mammalian recombinant protein expression.
  • Knowledge and experience in biology/biochemistry laboratory procedures and assays, including recombinant DNA techniques, antibody humanization, antibody engineering, antibody expression/purification, and characterization by ELISA, IP/WB, FACS etc.
  • Desire and ability to interact as a cross-functional team member to assist in downstream in vitro and in vivo assays.
  • Strong organizational skills and record keeping.
  • Self-motivated and willing to accept temporary responsibilities outside of initial job description.
  • Comfortable in a fast-paced small company environment and able to adjust workload based upon changing priorities.
-KKFiNckpfjZlmnOCgKW.name: Research Associate, Antibody Techology

-KKFioAjP6ZKpqYyKKTm.description:
Job Description

We currently have an opening for a talented individual who has a strong background in cell culture to join our team in the customer driven/based lab making antibodies.

Requirements

  • Minimum 2 years experience; ideally in industry
  • Minimum BA/BS required
  • Hands-on experience with monoclonal antibody generation, including immunizations, fusions, and subcloning preferred
  • Superior mammalian tissue cell culture expertise required
  • Proficiency in ELISA, FACS, and Western blot assays
  • Experience with SPR desired (Biacore, Octet, etc.)
  • Production and purification of antibodies desired
  • Experience with recombinant protein expression by transient and/or stable transfections preferred
  • Familiarity with immunoprecipitation and immunohistochemistry a plus
  • Strong computer and analytical software skills needed
  • Strong communications skills
  • Highly organized and strong documentation skills
  • Eager to learn new skills and laboratory techniques
  • Able to manage several projects simultaneously
  • Team player
  • Must have high initiative and superior work ethic
  • Strong record of past achievement
-KKFioAjP6ZKpqYyKKTm.name: Research Associate, Antibody Lab

field.content: Our technology platform allows us to generate products for our partners at unprecedented speeds and accesses new discoveries previously not possible. We are able to generate potential new therapeutics, diagnostics, animal health products, and research tools against targets that were previously inaccessible. Our platform has the capability to target the smallest molecular change possible, then design products against them, fine tune them to desired biological properties with precision, and then scale them up for use in an industrial setting.

grid.description: Nanoimmunology is the use of nanoscale reagents to boost, enhance, and modify immune responses and antibodies.
grid.name: Nano Immunology

grid.description: Bioinspired engineering takes nature’s engineering principles, designed through billions of years, and applies it to solve real-world problems.
grid.name: Bioinspired Engineering

grid.description: Synthetic biology is the engineering of biological entities using basic building blocks and engineering principles.
grid.name: Synthetic Biology

field.name: Abpro is a pioneer of industrial biochemistry.
field.overview: Industrial biochemistry leverages the latest technologies from synthetic biology, nanoimmunology, bioinspired engineering, and engineering principles and applies them to biology to drive dramatic gains in discovery capability.

grid.description: Ushering in solutions for a new life sciences enabled-era by leveraging vast amounts of information for optimized biomolecules to improve health
grid.headline: Pioneers of Industrial Biochemistry

grid.description: We create superior therapeutic antibodies that fight against traditionally difficult targets.
grid.headline: Biomolecules with No Limits

grid.description: Nature’s way to fight disease via our DiversImmune platform
grid.headline: Harnessing the Power of Nature’s Immune System

grid.description: High-throughput, industrial-scale automation for discovery, research, and diagnostics.
grid.headline: Accelerate R&D with our DiversImmune™ Platform

grid.description: Used by leading industry experts against difficult targets and for functional applications.
grid.headline: Proven Peer-Reviewed Technology

-KKLlkRlutpv4Dzbie2u.content:
1. Terms

By accessing this web site, you are agreeing to be bound by these web site Terms and Conditions of Use, all applicable laws and regulations, and agree that you are responsible for compliance with any applicable local laws. If you do not agree with any of these terms, you are prohibited from using or accessing this site. The materials contained in this web site are protected by applicable copyright and trade mark law.

2. Use License

  1. Permission is granted to temporarily download one copy of the materials (information or software) on Abpro's web site for personal, non-commercial transitory viewing only. This is the grant of a license, not a transfer of title, and under this license you may not:
    1. modify or copy the materials;
    2. use the materials for any commercial purpose, or for any public display (commercial or non-commercial);
    3. attempt to decompile or reverse engineer any software contained on Abpro's web site;
    4. remove any copyright or other proprietary notations from the materials; or
    5. transfer the materials to another person or "mirror" the materials on any other server.
  2. This license shall automatically terminate if you violate any of these restrictions and may be terminated by Abpro at any time. Upon terminating your viewing of these materials or upon the termination of this license, you must destroy any downloaded materials in your possession whether in electronic or printed format.

3. Disclaimer

  1. The materials on Abpro's web site are provided "as is". Abpro makes no warranties, expressed or implied, and hereby disclaims and negates all other warranties, including without limitation, implied warranties or conditions of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, or non-infringement of intellectual property or other violation of rights. Further, Abpro does not warrant or make any representations concerning the accuracy, likely results, or reliability of the use of the materials on its Internet web site or otherwise relating to such materials or on any sites linked to this site.

4. Limitations

In no event shall Abpro or its suppliers be liable for any damages (including, without limitation, damages for loss of data or profit, or due to business interruption,) arising out of the use or inability to use the materials on Abpro's Internet site, even if Abpro or a Abpro authorized representative has been notified orally or in writing of the possibility of such damage. Because some jurisdictions do not allow limitations on implied warranties, or limitations of liability for consequential or incidental damages, these limitations may not apply to you.

5. Revisions and Errata

The materials appearing on Abpro's web site could include technical, typographical, or photographic errors. Abpro does not warrant that any of the materials on its web site are accurate, complete, or current. Abpro may make changes to the materials contained on its web site at any time without notice. Abpro does not, however, make any commitment to update the materials.

6. Links

Abpro has not reviewed all of the sites linked to its Internet web site and is not responsible for the contents of any such linked site. The inclusion of any link does not imply endorsement by Abpro of the site. Use of any such linked web site is at the user's own risk.

7. Site Terms of Use Modifications

Abpro may revise these terms of use for its web site at any time without notice. By using this web site you are agreeing to be bound by the then current version of these Terms and Conditions of Use.

8. Governing Law

Any claim relating to Abpro's web site shall be governed by the laws of the State of Massachusetts without regard to its conflict of law provisions.

General Terms and Conditions applicable to Use of a Web Site.
-KKLlkRlutpv4Dzbie2u.name: Terms of Service

-KKLmVndlcj58WFb6a2g.content:
Your privacy is very important to us. Accordingly, we have developed this Policy in order for you to understand how we collect, use, communicate and disclose and make use of personal information. The following outlines our privacy policy.

  • Before or at the time of collecting personal information, we will identify the purposes for which information is being collected.
  • We will collect and use of personal information solely with the objective of fulfilling those purposes specified by us and for other compatible purposes, unless we obtain the consent of the individual concerned or as required by law.
  • We will only retain personal information as long as necessary for the fulfillment of those purposes.
  • We will collect personal information by lawful and fair means and, where appropriate, with the knowledge or consent of the individual concerned.
  • Personal data should be relevant to the purposes for which it is to be used, and, to the extent necessary for those purposes, should be accurate, complete, and up-to-date.
  • We will protect personal information by reasonable security safeguards against loss or theft, as well as unauthorized access, disclosure, copying, use or modification.
  • We will make readily available to customers information about our policies and practices relating to the management of personal information.

We are committed to conducting our business in accordance with these principles in order to ensure that the confidentiality of personal information is protected and maintained.
-KKLmVndlcj58WFb6a2g.name: Privacy Policy

-KJgFFgIb44omwUK_rEH.description: Abpro, an integrated life science company at the forefront of synthetic biology, today announced co-development agreements with Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) and Brigham and Women’s Hospital (BWH), two of the country’s leading academic medical centers
-KJgFFgIb44omwUK_rEH.name: Abpro Announces Agreements with Two Boston Hospitals

-KJgFWJ93KAoo4hBEDXq.description: Abpro, an integrated life science company at the forefront of synthetic biology, today announced a partnership with Essex Bio, a China-based biopharmaceutical company.
-KJgFWJ93KAoo4hBEDXq.name: Abpro Announces Investment and Partnership with Essex Bio

-KJgFiBUCc7UjKr37alX.description: Chan led a team from DNA Medicine Institute (DMI), a Cambridge-based medical technology incubator and lab, that developed rHEALTH, a compact portable device that can run hundreds of clinical lab tests on a single drop of blood with gold standard accuracy.
-KJgFiBUCc7UjKr37alX.name: Abpro Co-Founder Eugene Chan Wins Nokia Sensing XChallenge

-KKBVJ3d6w8g0aIg8264.description: Dr. Levy is widely known for his original work on Rituxan®, the first monoclonal antibody approved by the Food and Drug Administration for the treatment of cancer.
-KKBVJ3d6w8g0aIg8264.name: Abpro appoints Ron Levy M.D., to Scientific Advisory Board

-KKGNGB1D12F3uxGa1zI.form:
<form action="">
	<fieldset>
		<legend>Antigen type:</legend>
		<input type="checkbox" id="antigen-peptide" name="antigen-peptide"></input><label for="antigen-peptide">Peptide</label>
		<input type="checkbox" id="antigen-protein" name="antigen-protein"></input><label for="antigen-protein">Protein</label>
		<input type="checkbox" id="antigen-cells" name="antigen-cells"></input><label for="antigen-cells">Cells</label>
		<input type="checkbox" id="antigen-gpcr" name="antigen-gpcr"></input><label for="antigen-gpcr">GPCR</label>
		<input type="checkbox" id="antigen-phospho-target" name="antigen-phospho-target"></input><label for="antigen-phospho-target">Phospho-target</label>
		<input type="checkbox" id="antigen-anti-idiotype" name="antigen-anti-idiotype"></input><label for="antigen-anti-idiotype">Anti-idiotype</label>
	</fieldset>


	<fieldset>
		<legend>Origin of molecule</legend>
		<input type="checkbox" name="human" id="molecule_human"></input><label for="molecule_human">Human</label>
		<input type="checkbox" name="mouse" id="molecule_mouse"></input><label for="molecule_mouse">Mouse</label>
		<input type="checkbox" name="rat" id="molecule_rat"></input><label for="molecule_rat">Rat</label>
		<input type="checkbox" name="viral" id="molecule_viral"></input><label for="molecule_viral">Viral</label>
		<input type="checkbox" name="bacterial" id="molecule_bacterial"></input><label for="molecule_bacterial">Bacterial</label>
		<input type="checkbox" name="plant" id="molecule_plant"></input><label for="molecule_plant">Plant</label>
		<input type="checkbox" name="other" id="molecule_other"></input><label for="molecule_other">Other</label>
	</fieldset>

	<fieldset>
		<legend>Does your antigen have high homology to mouse protein?</legend>
		<input type="radio" name="homology" id="homology_yes"></input><label for="homology_yes">Yes</label>
		<input type="radio" name="homology" id="homology_no"></input><label for="homology_no">No</label>
	</fieldset>

	<fieldset>
		<legend>
			Please briefly describe the overall goal of your antibody you would like Abpro to develop. Please include how you plan to use this antibody as well as any conditions you would like the antibody to satisfy:
		</legend>
		<textarea name="" id="" cols="30" rows="10"></textarea>
	</fieldset>

	<fieldset>
		<label for="name">
			Name<sup class="text-red">*</sup>
			<input type="text" name="name" id="name" required>
		</label>

		<label for="company">
			Company/Institution<sup class="text-red">*</sup>
			<input type="text" name="company" id="company" required>
		</label>

		<label for="email">
			Email<sup class="text-red">*</sup>
			<input type="email" name="email" id="email" required>
		</label>

		<label for="phone">
			Phone Number
			<input type="text" name="phone" id="phone">
		</label>

		<label for="referral">
			How did you hear about us?
			<select name="referral" id="referral">
				<option value="" disabled selected>Choose one</option>
				<option value="email">Email Campaign</option>
				<option value="google">Google Ad</option>
				<option value="search">Internet search</option>
				<option value="colleague">Colleague</option>
				<option value="other">Other</option>
			</select>
		</label>

		<button type="submit" class="button">Submit request →</button>
	</fieldset>
</form>
-KKGNGB1D12F3uxGa1zI.name: Custom Monoclonal Antibodies

-KKGT_aQDvb8jDPA2dTc.form:
<form action="">
	<fieldset>
		<label for="strain">
			Strain of mouse/rat you will be using:
			<input type="text" name="strain" id="strain">
		</label>
	</fieldset>

	<fieldset>
		<label for="animals">
			Number of animals required:
			<input type="number" name="animals" id="animals">
		</label>
	</fieldset>

	<fieldset>
		<label for="duration">
			Estimated duration of the study:
			<input type="text" name="duration" id="duration">
		</label>
	</fieldset>

	<fieldset>
		<legend>Will Abpro provide bioanalysis?</legend>
		<input type="radio" name="bioanalysis" id="bioanalysis_yes"></input><label for="bioanalysis_yes">Yes</label>
		<input type="radio" name="bioanalysis" id="bioanalysis_no"></input><label for="bioanalysis_no">No</label>
	</fieldset>

	<fieldset>
		<legend>
			Please briefly describe the overall goal of the project you would like Abpro to initiate or develop:
		</legend>
		<textarea name="message" id="" cols="30" rows="10"></textarea>
	</fieldset>

	<!-- demographics -->

	<fieldset>
		<label for="name">
			Name<sup class="text-red">*</sup>
			<input type="text" name="name" id="name" required>
		</label>

		<label for="company">
			Company/Institution<sup class="text-red">*</sup>
			<input type="text" name="company" id="company" required>
		</label>

		<label for="email">
			Email<sup class="text-red">*</sup>
			<input type="email" name="email" id="email" required>
		</label>

		<label for="phone">
			Phone Number
			<input type="text" name="phone" id="phone">
		</label>

		<label for="referral">
			How did you hear about us?
			<select name="referral" id="referral">
				<option value="" disabled selected>Choose one</option>
				<option value="email">Email Campaign</option>
				<option value="google">Google Ad</option>
				<option value="search">Internet search</option>
				<option value="colleague">Colleague</option>
				<option value="other">Other</option>
			</select>
		</label>

		<button type="submit" class="button">Submit request →</button>
	</fieldset>
</form>

-KKGTlwxmDb3LYCuI0L5.name: ForteBio Octet Services

-KJgCB1ou-JKXUXofhL0.content:
Biologics, specifically antibody therapeutics, have significant human value to fight disease. Antibody therapeutics allow for targeted correction of pathological processes, leading to mitigation or correction of disease. Five of the top ten drugs worldwide are based on monoclonal antibodies. Abpro’s exceptional antibodies, generated from our DiversImmuneTM platform, are perfectly suited to treat disease.

We have partnered with leading companies to successfully develop many therapeutic antibodies against traditionally difficult targets. Please contact us to discuss more.

[image: pipeline chart]
-KJgCB1ou-JKXUXofhL0.description: Biologics, specifically antibody therapeutics, have significant human value to fight disease.
-KJgCB1ou-JKXUXofhL0.name: Therapeutics

-KJgCJ1uLOHz9yRn7ie4.content: Abpro is focused on delivering exceptional performing antibodies, with high sensitivity and specificity for diagnostics. The quality of a molecular diagnostic is almost completely dependent on the underlying quality of the antibodies. Through our DiversImmuneTM platform, we are able to generate the best antibodies for both human and veterinary health diagnostics
-KJgCJ1uLOHz9yRn7ie4.description: Abpro is focused on delivering exceptional performing antibodies, with high sensitivity and specificity for diagnostics.
-KJgCJ1uLOHz9yRn7ie4.name: Diagnostics

-KJgCPatGEwUhJHi1Jrp.content: The greatest discoveries in biomedical research lead to transformative changes in medicine, healthcare, and our well-being. This includes fields such as synthetic biology, immunology, genomics, and molecular biology. To support our firm belief in supporting biomedical research, Abpro is committed to providing exceptional technologies, products, and services to accelerate life sciences research.
-KJgCPatGEwUhJHi1Jrp.description: The greatest discoveries in biomedical research lead to transformative changes in medicine, healthcare, and our well-being.
-KJgCPatGEwUhJHi1Jrp.name: Research

-KK6q6Koprjst7SvKulF.content:
Abpro offers a comprehensive suite of antibody services, from gene synthesis to assay development. We have a broad range of options available to meet all of your antibody needs.

Monoclonal Antibody Development

We leverage our DiversImmune™ platform to generate antibodies that will work in your hands. Our platform is faster and more powerful, offering more diversity against previously difficult targets. We optimize for success starting from the beginning with powerful bioinformatics via our Biomax™ system. Should antigen be required, our RaptorTM system is massively parallel and allows high-speed generation; next, our Immunomax™ system generates large panels of antibody for your selection. This is followed by our Affinimax™ platform that optimizes for affinity.

The end result is that you’ll be working with one of the most powerful antibody development systems in the world to optimize for success.

Our platform has been well proven via literature and industry leaders. It is particularly well-suited for traditionally difficult targets and for situations where speed is critical. These can include the following:

  • Single-amino acid differences
  • GPCRs
  • Anti-idiotypic mabs
  • Conformationally specific epitopes
  • High homology targets (human, rat or mouse)
  • Small molecules
  • Bi-specific antibodies
  • Antibody drug conjugates
  • Biosimilars
  • Biobetters

Our platform has been successful in generating mabs against every major application, ranging from research, to diagnostics, animal health and therapeutics.
-KK6q6Koprjst7SvKulF.description: At Abpro, we develop custom antibodies that work in your hands and end applications.  Our team of experts will collaborate with you to design an antigen, immunization strategy, and screening workflow to meet your needs. We produce antibodies that work in your end application, whether it be routine screening, PK/PD studies, immunohistochemistry, western blot, flow cytometry or custom functional assays.
-KK6q6Koprjst7SvKulF.name: Antibody Development

-KK6r9dQtwffaERzTYX8.content:
Abpro has a highly talented team of immunoassay scientists with extensive assay development experience. Our team has delivered high quality, functional monoclonal antibodies and corresponding assays to traditionally difficult targets (e.g., GPCRs, high homology proteins, idiotypes). Our expertise includes, but is not limited to: sandwich ELISAs for diagnostic kit development, competition, neutralizing, and blocking assays for drug screening and development.

In addition to assay development, we also have high throughput screening capabilities. Our platform leverages state-of-the-art automation to process and screen a huge volume of samples accurately and efficiently. Our screening capabilities include:

  • ELISA
  • Affinity Ranking (ForteBio Octet™)
  • Western Blots
  • Flow Cytometry
  • Immunoprecipitation
  • Dot Blot

Assay development and high throughput screening can be included as part of a custom antibody development project or offered as an independent service.
-KK6r9dQtwffaERzTYX8.name: Assay Development

-KK6rHdwzuoQXafh22oa.content:
We are experts in custom protein expression. Abpro can deliver all your protein needs from accession number through expression and purification (and antibody development). Our proteins are of the highest quality with industry leading quality control procedures performed throughout the production process.

All of our proteins are produced using a versatile baculovirus-based system that allows us to express proteins in both major eukaryotic cell types: mammalian (HEK293) and insect (SF9 or HI5). Using the baculovirus system allows Abpro to efficiently express your target proteins with high levels of expression. The proteins that we produce are HIS tagged (with a cleavage option). Our proteins are primarily used as antigens in our antibody development platform, but the protein expression platform can also be utilized as a stand-alone, fee-for-service offering.

Advantages of Abpro’s baculovirus system
  • Ability to express proteins in mammalian and insect systems using the same baculovirus
  • Higher protein yields than transient or stable cell line expression
  • Preservation of native conformation and post-translatioanl modifications
  • Can be easily and rapidly scaled up for larger quantities
Why come to Abpro for protein expression?
  • Expertise – Our team has decades of high-throughput protein expression experience, as well as the publication history to prove it.
  • Technology – Abpro’s protein expression technology includes patented and proprietary technologies at multiple stages.
  • State-of-the-art equipment – Significant investment in automation at every stage in protein expression allows Abpro to achieve the highest quality deliverables.
  • Customer service – Every customer has a dedicated account representative who is available to answer questions by phone and e-mail. Our customers are also provided access to an online portal to view project status and review data in real-time.
Quality Control Available:
  • Purity
    • SDS- Page
    • Capillary Electrophoresis (Caliper)
    • Target: >95%
  • Concentration
    • Target: > 1mg/ml
  • Aggregation
    • Dynamic Light Scattering
    • Target : <25% aggregation
  • Identity
    • Mass spec (LCMS)
  • Activity assays

How to get started:

  • Contact our staff to initiate the proposal development processes
  • Before getting started on any project, our experienced technical staff will review the program details with you.
  • Acall or meeting will be scheduled with our team to discuss technical workflow
  • After that, our work begins!
-KK6rHdwzuoQXafh22oa.name: Antigen Generation

-KK6rUBvgVPMiE80z_mw.content:
With the wide range of rodent autoimmune and inflammatory models of human disease it can be confusing to decide which model is best for your particular drug development and research needs. Our immunology scientists have the knowledge and experience to help you design the most appropriate studies for your goals. We can provide you a comprehensive qualitative and quantitative assessment of immune cell populations and functional readouts. Examples of our disease models include:

  • Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
  • Multiple Sclerosis
  • Type 1 diabetes
  • Psoriasis
  • Inflammatory Bowel Disease
-KK6rUBvgVPMiE80z_mw.name: Inflammation and Autoimmune Models

-KK6rsuAMzbJ8xkhyefS.content:
Abpro offers in vivo preclinical pharmacology services in both mouse and rat using a full range of dosing administration routes and regimens for both small molecules and biologics. Tissue and body fluid samples can either be shipped to the sponsor or undergo bioanalysis at Abpro. Examples of our pharmacology study capabilities include:

  • Pharmacokinetics (with noncompartmental and compartmental analysis)
  • Repeat dosing studies to assess dosing linearity
  • Ascending dose studies to assess dosing proportionality
  • Bioavailability
  • Bioequivalence
-KK6rsuAMzbJ8xkhyefS.name: Pharmacology Services
-KK6rsuAMzbJ8xkhyefS.subtitle: Preclinical In Vivo Pharmacology Services.

-KK6rxyMxuDc77hhXPsz.content:
Abpro offers a full range of in vivo non-GLP toxicology services in both mice and rats providing early assessment of drug candidate toxicity allowing for a more informed drug discovery direction and more confident decision-making. Examples of our toxicology study capabilities include:

  • Toxicokinetics
  • Maximum tolerated dose estimation (fixed or up and down dosing schedule)
  • Acute toxicity (up to 14 days)
  • Subacute toxicity
  • Chronic toxicity
-KK6rxyMxuDc77hhXPsz.name: Toxicology Services
-KK6rxyMxuDc77hhXPsz.subtitle: Preclinical In Vivo Toxicology Services

-KK6s27QIZMencuD-XBe.content:
Whether you are assessing small molecule drug candidate efficacy in a human xenograft tumor mouse model, or evaluation of immune-based therapies in a syngeneic mouse tumor model, Abpro provides you with the expertise in a wide variety of models and dosing routes and regimens to suit your needs. Efficacy as measured by tumor growth kinetics can be combined with pharmacokinetics, clinical pathology, histopathology and local/systemic immune function profiling in the following models:

  • Xenograft tumor models
  • Syngeneic mouse tumor models (custom designed for your intended target)
-KK6s27QIZMencuD-XBe.name: Cancer Disease Models

-KK6sLLUjptqlE9Uu3sv.content:
Choosing the most appropriate model for your metabolic disease research and drug development projects is crucial for proper efficacy assessment of therapeutic interventions. At Abpro, we can work with you to choose the most appropriate model for your disease area from a wide array of genetic or (diet or drug) induced disease models. Examples include:

  • Type I and II diabetes models
  • Nutritional and genetic obesity models
  • Dyslipidemia
  • Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH)
-KK6sLLUjptqlE9Uu3sv.name: Metabolic Disease Models

-KK6purRBxfqzNKn-AWM.name: Preclinical Product Development
-KK6purRBxfqzNKn-AWM.overview: At Abpro, we offer a full range of in vivo preclinical early stage research, efficacy, pharmacology, and safety studies. With our expertise and experience, we can offer a wide range of standard study designs in pharmacology, toxicology, cancer xenograft, metabolic, and immunology models. Our hands-on collaborative approach with our clients means that our scientists will work with you to learn your specific preclinical study requirements and assist you from initial study design to final reporting of your data to provide you with dependable results.

advantages.description: Large unique panels of 50-1000+ functional antibodies

technology.headline: We're the leader in biochemical technology
technology.name: Technology
technology.overview: We have streamlined all aspects of the process to create a state-of-the-art gene-to-antibody platform that allows rapid generation of antibodies against previously difficult targets. Applications include use in research, as diagnostics or as therapeutics. Our platform has been well proven and validated by major pharmaceutical, biotechnology and academic labs around the world.

sections.content:
We take a highly industrialized approach in place of the traditional, labor-intensive, laboratory strategy. Our platform leverages advances in understanding of human genomes, synthetic biology, immunology, and advanced engineering to create a mechanized process that accelerates discovery.

Massively parallel process allows for the optimization of conditions for the antigen.

  • Parallel processing
  • Key components of the platform
  • Bioinformatics: BioMax™
  • Antigen Generation: Raptor™
  • Antibody Generation: ImmunoMax™
  • Affinity Development: AffiniMax™
  • Humanization
  • Disease Studies
sections.name: How does our platform work?

sections.content:
Abpro antibodies have proven to be successful against traditionally difficult targets, where other technologies have failed. Our proven technology has unique advantages in targeting very nuanced changes in structure. These changes may be variations in individual amino acids, conformation, methylation states, phosphorylation, glycosylation, idiotypes, or other modifications. The effectiveness of the platform arises from a tremendous diversity of candidates generated from its in vivo system and also the exceptional sensitivity and specificity of the final antibodies.

Key Advantages

  • Proven track record against over 500 targets
  • Antibodies generated naturally, via in vivo system
  • Highly specific against traditionally difficult targets, including conformational, single amino acid
  • Superior diversity against different epitopes
  • Exceptional affinities
  • Industry leading speed
  • Proven manufacturability and scalability
  • Less need for antibody engineering compared to other platforms
sections.name: Advantages
